title: Conversion Funnel Graph
$comment: Graph JSON for a conversion funnel DAG with inlined parameters and editor hints. Core semantics: nodes are states; edges are conditional transitions; probabilities are conditional on source node; outgoing edges form a partition that may leave residual routed to a default outcome unless overridden. Acyclicity, absorbing-node constraints, and per-source probability policies are validated by the runner.

Id.description: Human-readable identifier (letters, numbers, hyphens, underscores - no spaces or special chars)

label_overridden.description: If true, label was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

description_overridden.description: If true, description was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

event_id.description: Direct event ID for DAS queries (letters, numbers, hyphens, underscores)

id.description: Reference to event in events registry (letters, numbers, hyphens, underscores)

id_overridden.description: If true, event ID was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

absorbing.$comment: If true, node is terminal and MUST have zero outgoing edges; runner enforces.

costs.$comment: DEPRECATED: Node costs are no longer used. Costs are only tracked on edges (cost_gbp and cost_time). Runner calculates per-node costs by accumulating edge costs along paths.

case.description: Case/experiment node metadata (for A/B tests, feature flags, etc.)

source.description: Connection name used for this fetch

fetched_at.description: Timestamp of fetch (UK format or ISO)

path.description: How this data was retrieved: 'direct' = fetched directly from connection, 'file' = synced from case file

full_query.description: Complete query string used for this fetch (case_id + environment + any filters). Example: case(checkout_test).env(production)

debug_trace.description: Complete execution trace as JSON string for debugging/provenance

name_overridden.description: If true, name was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

weight_overridden.description: If true, weight was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

url.description: External URL for this node (can override registry node)

url_overridden.description: If true, URL was manually edited and should not auto-sync from registry

images.description: Images attached to this node (can override registry node)

caption_overridden.description: If true, caption was manually edited at graph level

images_overridden.description: If true, images array was manually modified and should not auto-sync from registry

from.$comment: Node uuid or id; runner canonicalizes to uuid and checks existence.

to.$comment: Node uuid or id; runner canonicalizes to uuid and checks existence.

fromHandle.description: Handle on source node where edge originates

toHandle.description: Handle on target node where edge terminates

label.description: Edge label (auto-derived from upstream/downstream nodes unless overridden)

label_overridden.description: If true, label was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

description_overridden.description: If true, description was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

query.description: Query expression for data retrieval (auto-generated by MSMDC or manual)

query_overridden.description: If true, query was manually edited and should not be auto-regenerated

n_query.description: Optional explicit query for n (denominator) when it differs from k query. Used when 'from' node shares an event with siblings and n can't be derived by stripping upstream conditions. Result's k (to_count) is used as n for the main query.

n_query_overridden.description: If true, n_query was manually edited and should not be auto-regenerated

p.$comment: Base probability (fallback when no conditional probabilities match). For case edges, variant weight is used instead.

conditional_p.description: Optional array of conditional probabilities. Evaluated in order; first match wins. Falls back to p if no matches.

weight_default.description: Used to distribute residual among free edges from the same source; proportional with others.

case_variant.description: Name of the variant this edge represents (for case edges only)

case_id.description: Reference to parent case node ID (for case edges only)

ProbabilityParam.$comment: p.mean is P(to|from). Primary value is what user sees/edits. Evidence (n/k) stored separately. Override flags use suffix pattern. If mean absent, edge is 'free' and filled by policy.

mean_overridden.description: If true, mean was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

stdev_overridden.description: If true, stdev was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

distribution.description: Probability distribution type (beta recommended for probabilities)

distribution_overridden.description: If true, distribution was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

evidence.description: Observations from data sources (context for n/k, NOT overridable). Optional fields depend on source type.

n.description: Sample size (total trials) - required for probability data with observations

k.description: Number of successes - optional, can be derived from n Ã— mean

window_from.description: Time window start (UK format d-MMM-yy or ISO)

window_to.description: Time window end (UK format d-MMM-yy or ISO)

retrieved_at.description: When this data was retrieved from source (UK format or ISO)

source.description: Connection name used for this retrieval

path.description: How this data was retrieved: 'direct' = fetched directly from connection, 'file' = synced from parameter file

full_query.description: Complete DSL query string used for this fetch (includes base query + window + context). Example: from(checkout).to(purchase).window(2025-01-01:2025-01-31).context(device:mobile)

debug_trace.description: Complete execution trace as JSON string (request, response, query, connection_string, etc.) for debugging/provenance. May be truncated if response is very large.

id.description: Reference to parameter file (FK to parameter-{id}.yaml)

CostParam.$comment: Cost structure (GBP monetary or time). Mirrors ProbabilityParam pattern with override flags and optional connection.

mean_overridden.description: If true, mean was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

stdev_overridden.description: If true, stdev was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

distribution_overridden.description: If true, distribution was manually edited and should not be auto-updated

evidence.description: Observations from data sources (context for n/k, NOT overridable). Optional fields depend on source type.

n.description: Sample size (total trials) - required for cost data with observations

window_from.description: Time window start (UK format d-MMM-yy or ISO)

window_to.description: Time window end (UK format d-MMM-yy or ISO)

retrieved_at.description: When this data was retrieved from source (UK format or ISO)

source.description: Connection name used for this retrieval

path.description: How this data was retrieved: 'direct' = fetched directly from connection, 'file' = synced from parameter file

full_query.description: Complete DSL query string used for this fetch (includes base query + window + context)

debug_trace.description: Complete execution trace as JSON string for debugging/provenance. May be truncated if response is very large.

id.description: Reference to cost parameter file (FK to parameter-{id}.yaml)

Condition.$comment: Condition uses query DSL constraint syntax: visited(A,B), exclude(C), context(device:mobile), case(test:treatment). Can be combined with dots: visited(A).context(mobile). Most specific condition wins at runtime.
Condition.description: Constraint expression using query DSL syntax (constraint clauses only, not full query)

ConditionalProbability.$comment: Conditional probability: probability that applies when specific condition is met. Condition is semantic (WHEN it applies), query is full retrieval path (HOW to fetch data). Query is auto-derived from condition + edge topology via MSMDC, but can be manually overridden.

query.description: Full data retrieval query (auto-derived from condition + edge topology). Example: from(checkout).to(purchase).visited(promo)

query_overridden.description: If true, query was manually edited and should not be auto-regenerated by MSMDC

EdgeDisplay.$comment: Display parameters for edges (not semantic, used by editor)

conditional_colour.description: User-selected colour override for conditional edges

conditional_group.description: Optional user-defined group for conditional colour assignment

Costs.$comment: DEPRECATED: This nested structure is no longer used. Use flat cost_gbp and cost_time fields on edges instead (both use CostParam). Kept for backward compatibility only.

MonetaryCost.$comment: DEPRECATED: No longer used. Use cost_gbp (CostParam) on edges instead. Currency is implicitly GBP.

TimeCost.$comment: DEPRECATED: No longer used. Use cost_time (CostParam) on edges instead. Units are implicitly days.

updated_at.description: Last update timestamp (UK format or ISO)
